Description: THIS PROGRAM WILL SUPPORT THE STATE OF HAWAII IN THE ADMINISTRATION OF THE LEAD-BASED PAINT ACCREDITATION PROGRAM, TRAINING INDIVIDUALS, AND ESTABLISHING WORKPLACE STANDARDS IN RESIDENTIAL HOUSING BUILT BEFORE 1978.  THE TRAINING OF INDIVIDUALS ENGAGED IN LEAD-BASED PAINT ABATEMENTS, ACCREDITATION OF TRAINING PROVIDERS, AND CERTIFICATION OF CONTRACTORS WILL RESULT IN A REDUCTION OF EXPOSURE TO LEAD RESULTING IN IMPROVED PUBLIC HEALTH.  THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES PARTIAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $182,863.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROGRAM IS TO CONTINUE TO OPERATE AN EPA-AUTHORIZED STATE LEAD ABATEMENT PROGRAM.  ACTIVITIES INCLUDE COMPLIANCE ASSISTANCE AND OUTREACH, INSPECTION, AND ENFORCEMENT OF CHAPTER 11-41, HAWAII ADMINISTRATIVE RULES.  WORKPLAN ACTIVITIES WILL ALSO INCLUDE EXPLORING THE GROUNDWORK FOR DEVELOPING A LEAD-BASED PAINT RENOVATION, REPAIR AND PAINTING (RRP) PROGRAM IN HAWAII.  THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $273,006.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROGRAM IS TO SUPPORT THE IMPLEMENTATION OF A LEAD BASED PAINT TRAINING AND CERTIFICATION PROGRAM PURSUANT TO SECTIONS 402 AND 404 OF TOXIC SUBSTANCE CONTROL ACT (TSCA), TITLE IV.  THIS AWARD PROVIDES PARTIAL FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $244,699.

FUNDS WILL BE USED FOR THE 2018 COMPREHENSIVE LEAD-BASED PAINT PROGRAM TO REDUCE THE RISK OF CHILDHOOD LEAD POISONING.   THIS IS AN INCREMENT OF FEDERAL FUNDS, FULL FUNDING MAY BE PROVIDED AT A LATER DATE CONTINGENT UPON THE AVAILABILITY OF CONTINUED FUNDING AND FINAL FEDERAL BUDGET DECISIONS.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO CONTINUE TO OPERATE AN EPA-AUTHORIZED STATE LEAD ABATEMENT PROGRAM.  RECIPIENT WILL (A) IMPROVE OPERATION OF THE CERTIFIED LEAD-RELATED CONSTRUCTION (LRC) PROFESSIONALS PROGRAM; (B) USE IMPROVED OUTREACH TO IMPLEMENT LRC ACCREDITATION AND CERTIFICATION AT THE STATE LEVEL; AND (C) INCREASE DEMAND FOR AND USE OF LRC PROFESSIONALS.    THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES PARTIAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $466,179.

THIS ACTION PROVIDES PARTIAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $50,000 TO THE STATE OF TENNESSEE TO FUND THE STATE PROGRAM TO REDUCE HEALTH RISKS POSED BY EXPOSURE TO LEAD-BASED PAINT BY ENSURING THAT INDIVIDUALS ENGAGED IN LEAD-BASED PAINT ACTIVITIES ARE CERTIFIED AND PROPERLY TRAINED, THAT FIRMS ENGAGED IN SUCH ACTIVITIES ARE CERTIFIED, THAT THESE ACTIVITIES ARE CONDUCTED APPROPRIATELY, AND THAT TRAINING PROGRAMS ARE ACCREDITED. IN ADDITION, THIS GRANT WILL FUND THE STATE'S WORK TO BECOME AUTHORIZED FOR AND IMPLEMENT THE PRE-RENOVATION EDUCATION RULE AND THE RENOVATION, REPAIR AND PAINTING RULE.

THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR THE OPERATION OF THE MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES CONTINUING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS WHILE GIVING IT GREATER FLEXIBILITY TO ADDRESS ITS HIGHEST ENVIRONMENTAL PRIORITIES, IMPROVE ENVIRONMENTAL  PERFORMANCE, ACHIEVE ADMINISTRATIVE SAVINGS AND STRENGTHEN THE PARTNERSHIP BETWEEN THE MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES AND EPA.  THE WORK INCLUDES OUTPUTS AND OUTCOMES ASSOCIATED WITH MANAGING CONTINUING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS WHICH INCLUDE ACTIVITIES TO PROTECT AND MAINTAIN LEAD AND ENFORCEMENT ACTIVITIES.

THIS PROGRAM WILL SUPPORT THE STATE OF MICHIGAN IN THE ADMINISTRATION AND ENFORCEMENT OF THE LEAD-BASED PAINT ACCREDITATION PROGRAM, TRAINING INDIVIDUALS, AND ESTABLISHING WORKPLACE STANDARDS IN RESIDENTIAL HOUSING BUILT BEFORE 1978. THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS GRANT PROGRAM IS TO ASSIST STATES, TRIBES, AND TERRITORIES IN DEVELOPING AND CARRYING OUT AUTHORIZED PROGRAMS THAT: (A) CERTIFY CONTRACTORS ENGAGED IN LEAD-BASED PAINT ACTIVITIES AND ACCREDIT LEAD-BASED PAINT ACTIVITIES TRAINING PROGRAMS; (B) CERTIFY CONTRACTORS ENGAGED IN RENOVATION, REPAIR AND PAINTING ACTIVITIES THAT DISTURB PAINTED SURFACES IN MOST TARGET HOUSING; AND/OR (C) REQUIRE DISTRIBUTION OF LEAD-HAZARD INFORMATION PRIOR TO RENOVATION.

DESCRIPTION:CHOCTAW NATION OF OKLAHOMA WILL EXAMINE AND INTENDS TO PURSUE OBTAINING EITHER FULL OR PARTIAL AUTHORIZATION OF THE FEDERAL LEAD-BASED PAINT ABATEMENT, ACCREDITATION, AND CERTIFICATION PROGRAM AND THE FEDERAL RENOVATE, REPAIR, AND PAINT RULE.  TO THE EXTENT TRIBAL LAW AND RULES ALLOW, DURING THE TERM OF THIS GRANT THE PROGRAM WILL INVESTIGATE THE FEASIBILITY OF THE FULL LEAD PAINT PROGRAM ADOPTION.

ACTIVITIES:DURING THE GRANT PERIOD, THE CHOCTAW NATION OF OKLAHOMA WILL:
-	REVIEW CURRENT TREATMENT AS A STATE (TAS) DOCUMENTS TO INCLUDE THE RESERVATION AREA OF THE CHOCTAW NATION OF OKLAHOMA WHICH WILL ESTABLISH STATUTORY AUTHORITY
-	IF ADEQUATE STATUTORY AUTHORITY EXISTS, DEVELOP TRIBAL CODES ADOPTING THE FEDERAL LEAD-BASED PAINT ABATEMENT, ACCREDITATION, AND CERTIFICATION PROGRAM.  
-	PURSUE DELEGATION OF AUTHORITY FOR THE TOXIC SUBSTANCE CONTROL ACT (TSCA) FOR LEAD-BASED PAINT ABATEMENT, ACCREDITATION, AND CERTIFICATION PROGRAM TO FULFILL EPA'S GOAL OF HAVING AUTHORIZED PROGRAMS ON THOSE TRIBAL LANDS WHERE SUCH A PROGRAM IS WARRANTEDSUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE CHOCTAW NATION WILL SUBMIT A MID AND END OF YEAR REPORT THAT WILL STATE ANY PROGRESS MADE TOWARDS UPDATING CURRENT TREATMENT AS A STATE (TAS) DOCUMENTS, ANY DIFFICULTIES ENCOUNTERED, AND REPORT ON WHETHER CONTINUED FUNDING OF THE PROGRAM ADOPTION WORK IS NEEDED.

WASHINGTON STATE REQUESTS FUNDING SUPPORT UNDER 404G OF TSCA FOR THE ADMINISTRATION OF A STATE CERTIFICATION, ACCREDITATION, COMPLIANCE AND ENFORCEMENT PROGRAM FOR PERSONS ENGAGED IN LEAD-BASED PAINT ACTIVITIES, RENOVATION AND PRE-RENOVATION WORK. THE GOAL OF WASHINGTON'S LEAD PROGRAM IS TO ELIMINATE CHILDHOOD LEAD POISONING IN WASHINGTON BY ENSURING AND ENFORCING COMPLIANCE WITH THE LEAD ENVIRONMENTAL LAWS AND REGULATIONS. WASHINGTON STATE HAS BEEN AUTHORIZED TO RUN THE LEAD ABATEMENT, RENOVATION, REPAIR AND PAINTING AND THE PRE-RENOVATION EDUCATION PROGRAMS. THIS FUNDING SUPPORTS THE WASHINGTON STATE AUTHORIZED LEAD PROGRAMS

THE GOAL OF OREGON'S LEAD PROGRAM IS TO ELIMINATE CHILDHOOD LEAD POISONING IN OREGON BY ENSURING AND ENFORCING COMPLIANCE WITH THE LEAD ENVIRONMENTAL LAWS AND REGULATIONS. OREGON STATE HAS BEEN AUTHORIZED TO RUN THE LEAD ABATEMENT, RENOVATION, REPAIR AND PAINTING AND THE PRE-RENOVATION EDUCATION PROGRAMS. THIS FUNDING SUPPORTS THE OREGON STATE AUTHORIZED LEAD PROGRAMS.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING FOR THE OPERATION OF THE VERMONT DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH'S CONTINUING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS WHILE GIVING IT GREATER FLEXIBILITY TO ADDRESS ITS HIGHEST ENVIRONMENTAL PRIORITIES, IMPROVE ENVIRONMENTAL  PERFORMANCE, ACHIEVE ADMINISTRATIVE SAVINGS AND STRENGTHEN THE PARTNERSHIP BETWEEN VERMONT DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND THE ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY (EPA). THIS AGREEMENT FUNDS STATEWIDE PROGRAMS TO:  

- SUPPORT THE STATE OF VERMONT IN THE ADMINISTRATION OF THE LEAD-BASED PAINT ACCREDITATION PROGRAM, TRAINING INDIVIDUALS, AND ESTABLISHING WORK PRACTICE STANDARDS IN RESIDENTIAL HOUSING BUILT BEFORE 1978.  THE TRAINING OF INDIVIDUALS ENGAGED IN LEAD-BASED PAINT ABATEMENTS, ACCREDITATION OF TRAINING PROVIDERS, AND CERTIFICATION OF CONTRACTORS WILL RESULT IN A REDUCTION OF EXPOSURE TO LEAD RESULTING IN IMPROVED PUBLIC HEALTH.

- SUPPORT VERMONT IN DEVELOPING AND MAINTAINING COMPLIANCE MONITORING PROGRAMS TO PREVENT OR ELIMINATE UNREASONABLE RISKS TO HEALTH OR THE ENVIRONMENT ASSOCIATED WITH CHEMICAL SUBSTANCES OR MIXTURES IN THEIR COMMUNITIES. SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL CONDUCT LEAD-BASED PAINT INSPECTIONS, ENCOURAGE REGULATORY ACTIVITIES WITHIN THE RECIPIENTS COMMUNITIES TO ESTABLISH THEIR OWN PROGRAMS FOR LEAD-BASED PAINT, AND PROVIDE FUNDS TO SUPPORT ENFORCEMENT ACTIVITIES FOR THE LEAD-BASED PAINT PROGRAM(S). 

THE WORK INCLUDES OUTPUTS AND OUTCOMES ASSOCIATED WITH MANAGING CONTINUING ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS WHICH INCLUDE ACTIVITIES TO PROTECT AND MAINTAIN CHEMICAL SAFETY.
ACTIVITIES:EDUCATION, OUTREACH, AND COMPLIANCE ASSISTANCE ON LEAD RULES 
-THE ALRP WILL RESPOND TO ALL EMAIL AND PHONE CALL INQUIRIES FROM THE TARGET AUDIENCE IN A TIMELY MANNER.  RESPONSES WILL BE PROVIDED BY ALL MEMBERS OF THE ALRP TEAM WITH MOST RESPONSES DELIVERED BY THE HEALTH ASBESTOS LEAD ENGINEERS AND THE ENVIRONMENTAL HEALTH SPECIALIST.  THE CALL LOGS WILL BE SENT QUARTERLY TO THE U.S. EPA.  
-THE ALRP WILL SEND A YEARLY MEMO TO ALL LEAD ABATEMENT AND RRP LICENSEES AND ACCREDITED TRAINERS.  THE EMAIL WILL BE SENT BY THE ALRP PROGRAM MANAGER.  
SUCCESS WILL BE MEASURED BY SENDING EMAIL TO ALL LICENSEE CONTACTS BY THE TIMELINE DATE AND RESPONDING TO ALL INQUIRIES WHICH RESULT FROM THE COMMUNICATION. 
-THE ALRP WILL UPDATE LEAD-BASED PAINT INFORMATION SHEETS INTENDED FOR DISTRIBUTION TO REGULATED FIRMS AND CONTRACTORS, LANDLORDS, RENTERS, HOMEOWNERS, CHILDCARE PROVIDERS.  INFORMATION SHEETS WILL BE UPDATED BY THE ALRP PROGRAM MANAGER IN COLLABORATION WITH THE ALRP AND HHLPPPF.   SUCCESS WILL BE MEASURED BY REVIEW AND FINALIZATION OF THE INFORMATION SHEETS BY THE VDH COMMUNICATIONS TEAM. 

ACCREDITATION AND LICENSING OF LEAD TRAINING PROFESSIONALS 
-LICENSE PROCESSING : IN ACCORDANCE WITH STATUTORY AND REGULATORY REQUIREMENTS, LICENSES ASSOCIATED WITH LEAD-BASED PAINT DISCIPLINES AND LABS WILL BE RECEIVED AND PROCESSED BY THE ALRP PROGRAM TECHNICIAN AND HEALTH ASBESTOS LEAD ENGINEER WITHIN 25 DAYS OF RECEIPT OF A COMPLETE AND ACCEPTABLE APPLICATION. 
SUCCESS TRACKING: THE ALRP WILL PROVIDE QUARTERLY REPORTS TO THE EPA PROJECT OFFICER DETAILING THE NUMBER OF LICENSES/CERTIFICATIONS PROCESSED PER QUARTER AND PERCENT PROCESSED ON TIME. 
- LEAD-BASED PAINT TRAINING COURSE ACCREDITATION : IN ACCORDANCE WITH STATUTORY AND REGULATORY REQUIREMENTS, APPLICATIONS FOR RRP AND LEAD ABATEMENT DISCIPLINES TRAINING COURSE ACCREDITATION WILL BE RECEIVED AND PROCESSED BY THE ALRP PROGRAM TECHNICIAN WITHIN 25 DAYS OF RECEIPT OF A COMPLETE AND ACCEPTABLE APPLICATION. 
SUCCESS TRACKING: THE ALRP WILL PROVIDE QUARTERLY REPORTS TO THE EPA PROJECT OFFICER DETAILING THE NUMBER OF COURSE ACCREDITATIONS PROCESSED PER QUARTER AND PERCENT PROCESSED ON TIME.

DESCRIPTION:AS THE PRIMARY COORDINATING AGENCY OF THE COMMONWEALTH FOR STATE LEAD PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT PURSUANT TO TSCA, TITLE IV, THE MASSACHUSETTS DEPARTMENT OF LABOR STANDARDS ('DLS') PROPOSES LEAD PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT INITIATIVES OF FOUR GENERAL TYPES IN FY2023/2024. THESE INITIATIVES ARE IN ACCORDANCE WITH USEPA PRIORITIES FOR DECENTRALIZATION OF TITLE IV LEAD REGULATORY OPERATIONS AND AUTHORITY TO THE STATES. IN ADDITION, THESE INITIATIVES APPLY EPA'S OPERATING PRINCIPLES FOR COMPLIANCE ASSISTANCE, COMPLIANCE MONITORING, INCENTIVES, AND ENFORCEMENT ACTIONS TO THE DEVELOPMENT OF THE MA LEAD TRAINING, ACCREDITATION AND CERTIFICATION PROGRAMS IN AN EFFECTIVE MANNER. THESE PROPOSED INITIATIVES, WHICH WILL BE FURTHER DESCRIBED, ARE TO CONDUCT OF LEAD-SAFE RENOVATION OR 'RRP' RULE INSPECTIONS; DELEADING COMPLIANCE INSPECTIONS, AND COMMERCIAL AND SUPERSTRUCTURE DELEADING INSPECTIONS AND CONDUCT TRAINING PROVIDER AUDITS. THIS WORK WOULD INCLUDE THE SUPPORT OF FIELD STAFF BY PROVIDING REAL-TIME INFORMATION DURING INSPECTIONS, AND THE DEVELOPMENT AND REFINEMENT OF INSPECTIONAL CHECKLISTS AND OTHER ENFORCEMENT PROTOCOLS. ADDITIONALLY, IT WOULD ALSO INCLUDE WORK TO DEVELOP AND/OR REVISE, AS NEEDED, REQUIREMENTS FOR THE ADMINISTRATION OF THIRD-PARTY ON-LINE CERTIFICATION EXAMS. RECENT REGULATIONS HAVE DETAILED THE REQUIREMENTS FOR TRAINING PROVIDERS PLANNING TO OFFER ON-LINE CERTIFICATIONS. DLS WILL UNDERGO EXTENSIVE WORK TO ENSURE THE IMPLEMENTATION OF THIS NEW OPTION MAINTAINS MASSACHUSETTS HIGH STANDARD OF LEAD TRAINING. 

 



 ACTIVITIES:1. CONDUCT AT LEAST 4 DELEADER-SUPERVISOR OR DELEADER-WORKER COURSE AUDITS. 
2. DLS PROPOSES TO CONTINUE REFINING THE LEAD-BASED PAINT PROGRAMS' 2017 ENFORCEMENT RESPONSE POLICY. 
3.DEVELOP AND/OR REVISE, AS NEEDED, REQUIREMENTS FOR THE ADMINISTRATION OF THIRD-PARTY ON-LINE CERTIFICATION EXAMS.  
4.FOSTER ACTIVITIES THAT INCREASE PUBLIC DEMAND FOR CERTIFIED FIRMS AND INDIVIDUALS BY CONDUCTING THE FOLLOWING EFFORTS: 
5.DLS WILL SUPPORT LEAD-SAFE RENOVATION OR 'RRP' RULE INSPECTIONS; AND SUPPORT DELEADING COMPLIANCE INSPECTIONSSUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:EXPECTED OUTCOMES FOR THE FIRST PERIOD OF THE GRANT (OCTOBER 1, 2022 - MARCH 31, 2023): 
CONDUCT TWO (2) AUDITS OF A DELEADER-WORKER OR DELEADER SUPERVISOR TRAINING COURSE. PROVIDE EPA WITH ALL NONS, ICIS FORMS AND INSPECTION REPORTS. MAKE ENFORCEMENT REFERRALS TO EPA, WHERE APPROPRIATE; REFINE WW PROCESS, AND EDIT ERP AS APPROPRIATE BASED ON NEW PROCESS; PROVIDE GUIDANCE FOR THIRD-PARTY TRAINING PROVIDERS REGARDING ON-LINE TRAINING. REVIEW ON-LINE COURSES AND EXAM APPLICATIONS AS THEY ARE SUBMITTED. MONITOR ON-LINE COURSES AND EXAMS; MEET WITH 40 MUNICIPAL BUILDING AND HEALTH DEPARTMENTS TO PROVIDE INFORMATION AND OUTREACH MATERIALS ON LSR; MEET WITH MUNICIPAL BUILDING DEPARTMENTS TO PROPOSE ADDING LSR CERTIFICATION AS A CONDITION FOR BEING GRANTED A BUILDING PERMIT; RESEARCH AND CONTACT 20 CONTRACTORS TO INFORM THEM OF LSR REQUIREMENTS, AND GUIDE THEM THROUGH THE TRAINING AND CERTIFICATION PROCESS. 
 
EXPECTED OUTCOMES FOR THE SECOND PERIOD OF THE GRANT (PERIOD (APRIL 1, 2023 - SEPTEMBER 30, 2023) 
CONDUCT TWO (2) AUDITS OF A DELEADER-WORKER OR DELEADER SUPERVISOR TRAINING COURSE; PROVIDE EPA WITH ALL NONS, ICIS FORMS AND INSPECTION REPORTS THROUGH ACS CHART. MAKE ENFORCEMENT REFERRALS TO EPA, WHERE APPROPRIATE; MONITOR EFFECTIVENESS OF REVISED WW PROCESS, AND EDITED ERP; REFINE CCCP PROCESS AND EDIT ERP AS APPROPRIATE; PROVIDE GUIDANCE FOR THIRD-PARTY TRAINING PROVIDERS REGARDING ON-LINE TRAINING. REVIEW ON-LINE COURSES AND EXAM APPLICATIONS AS THEY ARE SUBMITTED. MONITOR ON-LINE COURSES AND EXAMS; MEET WITH 20 MUNICIPAL BUILDING AND HEALTH DEPARTMENTS TO PROVIDE INFORMATION AND OUTREACH MATERIALS ON LSR; CONTINUE EFFORTS WITH MUNICIPAL BUILDING DEPARTMENTS TO PROPOSE ADDING LSR CERTIFICATION AS A CONDITION FOR BEING GRANTED

THIS PROGRAM WILL SUPPORT THE STATE OF MASSACHUSETTS IN THE ADMINISTRATION OF THE LEAD-BASED PAINT ACCREDITATION PROGRAM, TRAINING INDIVIDUALS, AND ESTABLISHING WORK PRACTICE STANDARDS IN RESIDENTIAL HOUSING BUILT BEFORE 1978.  THE TRAINING OF INDIVIDUALS ENGAGED IN LEAD-BASED PAINT ABATEMENTS, ACCREDITATION OF TRAINING PROVIDERS, AND CERTIFICATION OF CONTRACTORS WILL RESULT IN A REDUCTION OF EXPOSURE TO LEAD RESULTING IN IMPROVED PUBLIC HEALTH.

PER YOUR APPLICATION REQUEST DATED MAY 4 2018, THISE GRANT AGREEMENT IS BEING AWARD PARTIAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $275.00 TO THE MASSACHUSETTS DEPARTMEN OF LABOR STANDARDS. THESE FUNDS WILL SUPPORT THE ADMINISTRATION AND ENFORCEMENT OF THE LEAD-BASED PAINT ACCREDITATION PROGRAM, TRAINING INDIVIDUALS, AND ESTABLISHING WORKPLACE STANDARDS IN RESIDENTIAL HOUSING BUILT BEFORE 1978.  THE TRAINING OF INDIVIDUALS ENGAGED IN LEAD-BASED PAINT ABATEMENTS, ACCREDITATION OF TRAINING PROVIDERS, AND CERTIFICATION OF CONTRACTORS WILL RESULT IN A REDUCTION OF EXPOSURE TO LEAD-BASED PAINT HAZARDS RESULTING IN IMPROVED PUBLIC HEALTH.
